titles.title: A resolution on the visit of Oliver Tambo.

action.text: Submitted in the Senate. Read the first time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under Over, Under the Rule.
Indefinitely postponed by Senate by Unanimous Consent.

bill.summary: 1/28/1987--Introduced. Expresses the sense of the Senate that the Secretary of State, having met with African National Congress (ANC) leader Oliver Tambo, should: (1) demand that the ANC disavow the use of terrorism, including "necklacing" to advance its political aims; and (2) inform Tambo that the United States will oppose ANC participation in political negotiations over the future of South Africa until the ANC disavows the use of terrorism and is not closely tied to or influenced by the South African Communist Party or the Soviet Union.
